FRANCE: BAPTISM, 1704. The baptism of the first-born son of Louis, Duke of Burgundy and Marie-Adelaide of Savoy (in bed in the background). Present are King Louis XIV (seated); Louis, le Grand Dauphin at left; and the Duke of Burgundy next to the priest. Line engraving, c1704

Granger holds millions of images spanning more than 25,000 years of world history, from before the Stone Age to the dawn of the Space Age

Media ID 7560769

1704 Adelaide Baptism Bed Room Burgundy Ceremony Dauphin Duchess Duke Grand Louis Louis Xiv Marie Priest Royalty Savoy First Born

EDITORS COMMENTS

FRANCE: BAPTISM, 1704. A momentous occasion unfolds in this line engraving from 1704. The image captures the baptism of the first-born son of Louis, Duke of Burgundy and Marie-Adelaide of Savoy. In the background lies Marie-Adelaide in bed, witnessing the sacred ceremony taking place before her eyes. Seated prominently is none other than King Louis XIV himself, a figure exuding power and authority. To his left stands Louis, le Grand Dauphin, heir to the French throne and father to the child being baptized. The Duke of Burgundy can be seen next to the priest, displaying his devotion as he participates in this significant event. This enchanting print showcases an intimate glimpse into French royalty during this early period. It portrays not only a religious rite but also highlights familial bonds and dynastic succession within the monarchy. The intricate details captured by this line engraving offer viewers a window into history â€“ from the opulent interior setting to each individual's attire meticulously depicted. This piece is part of Granger Art on Demand's Carousel Collection which celebrates historical moments through art prints. Immerse yourself in this snapshot from 18th-century France and explore how tradition intertwines with regal splendor.
